entries.title: A Senator's Twitter Account Was Suspended Over a Hunting Photo. Then Elon Musk Stepped In.
entries.description: Steve Daines, a Montana Republican, said his account was blocked over a picture flagged for “graphic violence.”

entries.title: Microsoft Adds ChatGPT AI Technology to Bing Search Engine
entries.description: The breakout success of OpenAI has put Microsoft at the forefront of what some see as the next wave of technological innovation.

entries.title: Commerce Officials to Detail Chips Act Application Process This Month
entries.description: The announcement is expected to set off a push by chip makers for $53 billion in federal subsidies.

entries.title: Washington, D.C., Has More Tech Job Openings Than Silicon Valley
entries.description: Some of the hottest job markets for software developers and programmers now are on the East Coast.

entries.title: Crypto Brands Reposition Themselves in Wake of FTX and Market Tumble
entries.description: Once crypto was marketed as the transgressive future of finance. Now its message is simpler: dependability, transparency and trust. As one crypto chief put it: ‘Boring is not bad.’

entries.title: Meta to Revamp Horizon Metaverse App, Plans to Open for Teen Use as Soon as March
entries.description: Facebook parent Meta’s new strategy for its fledgling Horizon Worlds metaverse app includes opening it up to teens aged 13 to 17.

entries.title: SoftBank Loses Nearly $6 Billion in Quarter as Investments Suffer
entries.description: SoftBank Group said it fell back into the red in the three months to December as its investment vehicles posted a loss of nearly $6 billion.
